tool.name: FeatureFinderMetaboIdent
tool.description: Detects features in MS1 data based on metabolite identifications.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir id && ln -s '$id' 'id/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $id.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($id.ext)' && mkdir out && #if $lib_out_FLAG: mkdir lib_out && #end if #if $chrom_out_FLAG: mkdir chrom_out && #end if #if $candidates_out_FLAG: mkdir candidates_out && #end if #if $trafo_out_FLAG: mkdir trafo_out && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -id 'id/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $id.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($id.ext)' -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' #if $lib_out_FLAG: -lib_out 'lib_out/output.${gxy2omsext("traml")}' #end if #if $chrom_out_FLAG: -chrom_out 'chrom_out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' #end if #if $candidates_out_FLAG: -candidates_out 'candidates_out/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' #end if #if $trafo_out_FLAG: -trafo_out 'trafo_out/output.${gxy2omsext("trafoxml")}' #end if
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' '$out' #if $lib_out_FLAG: && mv 'lib_out/output.${gxy2omsext("traml")}' '$lib_out' #end if #if $chrom_out_FLAG: && mv 'chrom_out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' '$chrom_out' #end if #if $candidates_out_FLAG: && mv 'candidates_out/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' '$candidates_out' #end if #if $trafo_out_FLAG: && mv 'trafo_out/output.${gxy2omsext("trafoxml")}' '$trafo_out' #end if #if $adv_opts_cond.ctd_out_FLAG && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in
param.label: Input file: LC-MS raw data

param.name: id
param.label: Input file: Metabolite identifications

param.name: lib_out_FLAG
param.label: Generate output lib_out (Output file: Assay library)

param.name: chrom_out_FLAG
param.label: Generate output chrom_out (Output file: Chromatograms)

param.name: candidates_out_FLAG
param.label: Generate output candidates_out (Output file: Feature candidates (before filtering and model fitting))

param.name: trafo_out_FLAG
param.label: Generate output trafo_out (Output file: Retention times (expected vs)

param.name: mz_window
param.label: m/z window size for chromatogram extraction (unit: ppm if 1 or greater, else Da/Th)

param.name: n_isotopes
param.label: Number of isotopes to include in each assay

param.name: isotope_pmin
param.label: Minimum probability for an isotope to be included in the assay for a compound
param.help: If set, this parameter takes precedence over 'extract:n_isotopes'

param.name: rt_window
param.label: RT window size (in sec.) for chromatogram extraction

section.name: detect
section.title: Parameters for detecting features in extracted ion chromatograms

param.name: peak_width
param.label: Expected elution peak width in seconds, for smoothing (Gauss filter)
param.help: Also determines the RT extration window, unless set explicitly via 'extract:rt_window'

param.name: min_peak_width
param.label: Minimum elution peak width
param.help: Absolute value in seconds if 1 or greater, else relative to 'peak_width'

param.name: signal_to_noise
param.label: Signal-to-noise threshold for OpenSWATH feature detection

section.name: model
section.title: Parameters for fitting elution models to features

param.name: type
param.label: Type of elution model to fit to features

param.name: add_zeros
param.label: Add zero-intensity points outside the feature range to constrain the model fit
param.help: This parameter sets the weight given to these points during model fitting; '0' to disable

param.name: unweighted_fit
param.label: Suppress weighting of mass traces according to theoretical intensities when fitting elution models

param.name: no_imputation
param.label: If fitting the elution model fails for a feature, set its intensity to zero instead of imputing a value from the initial intensity estimate

section.name: check
section.title: Parameters for checking the validity of elution models (and rejecting them if necessary)

param.name: min_area
param.label: Lower bound for the area under the curve of a valid elution model

param.name: boundaries
param.label: Time points corresponding to this fraction of the elution model height have to be within the data region used for model fitting

param.name: width
param.label: Upper limit for acceptable widths of elution models (Gaussian or EGH), expressed in terms of modified (median-based) z-scores; '0' to disable

param.name: asymmetry
param.label: Upper limit for acceptable asymmetry of elution models (EGH only), expressed in terms of modified (median-based) z-scores; '0' to disable

param.name: force
param.label: Overwrite tool specific checks

param.name: ctd_out_FLAG
param.label: Output used ctd (ini) configuration file

tool.help:
Detects features in MS1 data based on metabolite identifications.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/documentation/UTILS_FeatureFinderMetaboIdent.html
